definition: to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations

sentences.english: Teachers follow the principle of student priority in the course of error correction.
sentences.chinese: 在纠错中教师应尽量给予学生独立修正偏误的优先权。

sentences.english: Of the opposite sex is to bring Vietnamese students learning obstacles, a bias.
sentences.chinese: 相异性则给越南学生的学习带来障碍，出现偏误。

sentences.english: The reasons are the misunderstandings to some related words caused by punctuation by the editors.
sentences.chinese: 究其原因，应该是断句者对相关词语的理解偏误所致。

sentences.english: Error of synonym using is a quite outstanding kind among the error of word using.
sentences.chinese: 在词语偏误中，近义词的使用偏误是较为突出的一类。

sentences.english: Error of synonym using is a quite outstanding kind among the error of word using.
sentences.chinese: 在词语偏误中，近义词的使用偏误是较为突出的一类。

sentences.english: Foreign students tend to make errors in these aspects.
sentences.chinese: 留学生会由于在这些方面辨识不清而产生偏误。

definition: wise after the event (idiom); with hindsight, one should have predicted it
circular argument/logical error consisting of begging the question/Latin: petitio principii
unable to see the wood for the trees/fig. only able to see isolated details, and not the bigger picture
pinyin: zhi3 jian4 shu4 mu4 bu4 jian4 sen1 lin2
bu4 wan2 quan2 gui1 na4 tui1 li3
